etymologies: late 17th century; earliest use found in William Petyt (?1641–1707), lawyer and political propagandist. From scriven + -ing

definitions: Originally: the work or occupation of a scribe, clerk, or secretary (now chiefly historical). Later often more generally: the action or practice of writing; the work of a writer.

etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in David Garrick (1717–1779), actor and playwright. From scriven + -ing

definitions: That works as a scribe, clerk, or secretary. Sometimes more generally: that writes; that is a writer.
